user_question: Which Youtube does the slides use to show the consequce of blindly following data?

knowledge_chain.query: Which YouTube video is referenced in the slides to show the consequence of blindly following data?
knowledge_chain.raw_result:
The YouTube video referenced in the context to illustrate the consequence of blindly following data is linked to the incident where **girls crashed into a lake after following bad GPS directions**. This event serves as a real-world example of how over-reliance on data (in this case, GPS navigation) can lead to failure when human judgment or intuition is ignored.

The video is associated with the **YouTube Video Link** entity, which points to the URL:  
**https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a2QlH2uz3p8**

This video likely elaborates on the story or provides commentary on the dangers of uncritically trusting data systems without cross-checking or applying contextual awareness.

### References

- [1] Girls Crash into Lake
- [2] YouTube Video Link
- [3] GPS
knowledge_chain.summary: The slides reference a YouTube video illustrating the consequence of blindly following data, using the real-world example of girls crashing into a lake after following incorrect GPS directions. The video is available at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a2QlH2uz3p8 and highlights the dangers of over-relying on data systems without applying human judgment or contextual awareness.
